channel.title: Green Ruby
channel.description: Green Ruby News is a feed of fresh links of the week about ruby, javascript, webdev, devops, collected by mose every sunday

item.title: Green Ruby News #179
item.content:encoded:
#179 - jul 10th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Oak Studios
Elegant and simple.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Ruby or Rails?
Let's check whether you remember where Ruby ends and Rails starts.
Definitely Typed
The repository for high quality TypeScript type definitions.
Siteleaf
Static website as a Service.
Places to Work
The biggest collection of 10,336 places to work worldwide with fast WiFi, power outlets, great coffee and ergonomic seating for digital nomads to work remotely.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Jsonapi-utils
Build JSON APIs with ease.
Felony
PGP keychain built with Electron, React, and Redux.
React-elm-components
Write React components in Elm
Moeditor
Electron markdown editor.
TLS-observatory
An observatory for TLS configurations, X509 certificates, and more.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Parsing Binary Data Formats jul 5
Use bindata gem and do some basic steganography.
Control the Physical World with Ruby and Artoo jul 5
Control and interact with lots of different hardware platforms (e.g. the Sphero, the Arduino, etc.).
Securing Your IoT Devices and Services with JSON Web Tokens jul 5
IoT security is a hot-button issue in todayâ€™s world.
Setting up a Home VPN Server Using Your Raspberry Pi jul 5
Turn a Raspberry Pi into a VPN to connect to a home network remotely.
Announcing AptWatcher jul 6
Collect information about package updates from servers to Slack notifications channel.
Trying to match C-based Fast Blank with Crystal jul 6
Some C experiments on Crystal.
Fixing data corruption and socket leak issues in Rails 5 jul 7
During performance testing of the Rails 5.0.0 release we discovered two bugs in Rails.
A Recipe for mRuby Raspberry Pi? Just Add h2o! jul 7
Use a RPi to make one of those visual doorbells that you can buy for $129.
The Bash For Loop, The First Step in Automation on Linux jul 7
Mastering the for loop in Bash on Linux is one of the fundamentals for Linux sysadmins.
Why we use the Linux kernel's TCP stack jul 7
Feedback from a Cloudflare engrineer.
How We Do Spikes jul 8
How Acquisio solves rails assets pipeline problem using spikes discussion.
5 Tips for Writing a Legible Regexp jul 8
Use %r with x option and single interpolation.
Integrating Content Security Policy into your Rails applications jul 8
Prevent wide categories of attacks using CSP.
A Front End Developer is Aware jul 8
Everybody involved in a web team ends up talking with the front end developers.
A checklist for Docker in the Enterprise jul 8
Areas that may be important to an enterprise when considering developing a Docker infrastructure.
Using Hashicorp Vault as a PKI SSL/TLS CA jul 9
Encrypting data is important, both in transit and at rest.

item.title: Green Ruby News #178
item.content:encoded:
#178 - jul 3rd 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Love filia
Good demonstration of fast graphical animation with sound.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
HumanOps
HumanOps is a set of principles which focus on the human aspects of running infrastructure.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Rails 5.0 jun 30
Action Cable, API mode, and so much more. After six months of polish, four betas, and two release candidates, Rails 5.0 is finally done!
cells
View components for Ruby and Rails.
resugan
Simple event driven architecture framework.
income-tax
Ruby library to calculate the income tax for any country.
active_params
Automatic strong parameters by JSON config.
vsafe-ruby
Ruby API Library for Vesta's vSafe Payment Gateway.
Go kit
A toolkit for microservices

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Why is a BasicObject a Range? jun 26
Fun with a ruby bug.
Automatically fetch your projectâ€™s dependencies with gb jun 26
Dependencies management is still a work in progress in Go.
A History of CSS Image Replacement jun 27
Explore various image replacement techniques.
Blockchainâ€™s Future after Bitcoin jun 27
Blockchain can be used for far more things than cash.
Add to Cart Interaction in CSS and jQuery jun 28
A floating cart that slides in when the user decides to buy an item.
VersionEye goes open source jun 28
VersionEye is a popular platform for software developers, which notifies you about out-dated dependencies.
Introducing the CSS text-align-last Property jun 29
The text-align-last property specifies how either the last line of a block or the line right before a forced line break will be aligned.
Elixirâ€™s Ecto Querying DSL: Beyond the Basics jun 29
Query composition, joins and associations, SQL fragment injection, explicit casting, and dynamic field access.
RSpec be_within matcher jun 29
Explaination of less used be_within matcher in RSpec.
JavaScript Design Patterns: The Singleton jun 30
Write singletons by leveraging ES6 features, mainly modules and the new const variable declaration.
Browser Trends July 2016: Is a Chrome Monoculture Harmless? jul 1
Another update in browser trends from May to June.
Avoid Mutation â€“ Functional Style In Ruby jul 3
Incorporate functional programming concepts into Ruby code

Everything you could ever want to know (and more) about controlling the Referer header.

The 5 areas to improve, how and why.

Options available to Rubyists regarding immutability.
Content Jumping (and How To Avoid It) jun 21

Changes that are not entirely backward compatible.

#176 - jun 19th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.

A visual experiment showing your likes from the face book.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.

Ruby Tricks, Idiomatic Ruby, Refactorings and Best Practices

Version Control, Collaboration & Coding for Front-end Developers (in beta).

Install

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
50 Most Common Ruby on Rails Mistakes Beginner Developers Make jun 13
The list of common Ruby on Rails mistakes that beginner developers are unaware of/do wrong or donâ€™t do at all. And how to avoid them.

Metaprogramming in Ruby jun 15
Metaprogramming is fantastic but only when it is used sparingly.
Hands-on Functional Programming with Ramda.js jun 15
Ramda.js is a library that we can use to help us getting started with functional programming using JavaScript.
An Introduction to Elixirâ€™s Ecto Library jun 15
Ecto is the main library for working with databases in Elixir.
Samsung acquires Joyent: A CTOâ€™s perspective jun 15
Quite a big news this week. Here is an insider insight.
Accessing the Userâ€™s Camera with JpegCamera and Canvas jun 16
JpegCamera takes the pain out of using the userâ€™s camera in your application without needing to worry about cross-browser compatibility.
How to Find Cool, Quirky, Copyright Free Photos on Flickr jun 16
Find images that are in the public domain and copyright free.
Quick Tip: Add Favicons Quickly and Easily to Your HTML jun 16
Favicons generally arenâ€™t easy to manage. Because of the fragmentation of both mobile and desktop operating systems and browsers.
Preserving session with Mechanize jun 17
The Mechanize library is used for automating interaction with websites.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Exploring Cryptography Fundamentals in Ruby jun 6

Building a WebRTC Video Chat Application with PeerJS jun 7

Quick Tip: How z-index and Auto Margins Work in Flexbox jun 9
Explore some flexbox tricks.
Introducing Drizzle jun 9
Tool for generating pattern libraries and style guides.
The Importance of Code Reviews jun 10

item.title: Green Ruby News #174
item.content:encoded:
#174 - jun 5th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.

Coz' sometimes you feel guilty for using jQuery.

Developer playground for building web app fast.
Project Soli
New interaction sensor using radar technology.
Rove
Service that allows you to pregenerate typical Vagrant builds

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Time Math
TimeMath2 is a small, no-dependencies library attempting to make time arithmetics easier.
sysrandom
Secure random number generation for Ruby using system RNG facilities
Related
Pure Ruby relational algebra.
Janky
Continuous integration server built on top of Jenkins and Hubot
Temple
Template compilation framework in Ruby
Oasis.js
A lightweight library for embedding untrusted content and exposing capabilities.
Xeon
Module loader for shell scripts with 'require' style.
Bluebird
Full featured promise library with unmatched performance.
Family.scss
Set of 24 smart Sass mixins to manage the style of :nth-childâ€™ified elements.
Flex Layout Attribute
Custom HTML layout attribute designed to serve you as quick flexbox shorthand.
Texttop
A fully interactive X Linux desktop rendered in TTY and streamable over SSH
Black-screen
A terminal emulator for the 21st century (made with electron).
Lantern
Internet proxy tool that lets you access blocked sites

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
A Comprehensive Guide to Interacting With IMAP Using Ruby may 30
All the steps to make your ruby app become a mail client.
Abstractions and the role of a framework may 30
This is a follow-up to the discussion that was started last week 'My time with Rails is up'.
Beyond YML Files may 31
Save translation into database and users can edit it from the Rails app.
3 pleasantly surprising postgreSQL indexing tricks may 31
A few quite advanced indexing techniques.
Saving Sprockets may 31
What do you do when a maintainer leaves a project with over 51 million downloads?
Harnessing the Google Maps JavaScript API the Right Way jun 1
There are lots of tutorials and examples already out there for this, but too often without a focus on the best way of achieving the desired result.
IFacebook's text understanding engine jun 1
DeepText can understand with near-human accuracy the textual content of several thousand posts per second, spanning more than 20 languages.
Learn Concurrency by Making a Countdown Latch in Ruby jun 2
A Countdown Latch is a concurrency abstraction that allows one or more threads to wait until all other threads are done with what they are doing.
Regular Expressions in JavaScript june 2
What, exactly, regular expressions are and what they can do for you.
Introducing the CSS clip-path Property jun 2
clip-path is css3 a property which allows you to prevent a portion of an element from being displayed.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Get a Whiff of This by Sandi Metz (38m) may 28
Most new requirements change existing code. Ergo, much our work involves altering imperfect code.

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...

Make a Simple JavaScript Slideshow without jQuery may 26
The main benefits of not using a library for your slideshow are that your page performs better.
Quick Tip: 4 Really Useful, Re-Useable Code Snippets from Codepen may 28
The worldâ€™s best front-end people deliver their ideas to us in pretty windows.

Look

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Procs and Lambdas: Closures in Ruby may 16
An in-depth look into Ruby's proc and lambda.
5 useful examples from the Ruby Standard Library may 16
The Ruby Standard Library is a series of modules & classes that come with Ruby but are not part of the language itself.

All or Nothing may 18
The all property is a shortcut for resetting all of the properties on a given element.
CSS coding techniques may 18
Some tips and recommendation to write better, easier-to-maintain CSS code.
Get the Lowdown on Ruby Modules may 19
Some developers are still confused about how modules work and how they interact with their own code.
Web Image Effects Performance Showdown may 19
tl;dr: Just don't use canvas for filters.
A bit about decorators and presenters may 20
Dive in to the decorator and presenter pattern and see what makes them simillar, but unique.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Building Fast & Resilient Web Applications (40m) may 20
Carving out the fast path is not enough. We need to make our applications resilient.

Look
